intro: Cremanthodium glandulipilosum, commonly known as the glandular-hairy cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are glandular and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance and aiding in water retention. The small, yellowish flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
